response.overview: Science is studying ghosts? Really? In this Best Documentary film festival winner, a widow suffering prolonged grief agrees to participate in a research study that aims to reconnect bereaved survivors with their departed loved ones. The process is known as Induced After-Death Communication (IADC), and it is rapidly gaining recognition among psychologists, academics and bereavement professionals.  â€‹LIFE WITH GHOSTS records the first-ever publicly funded attempt to facilitate contact with deceased individuals to determine if such contact can be used to reduce severe grief symptoms. In an area where traditional talk therapy has been largely ineffective, at a time when 70,000 Americans die from prescription drug misuse in a single year, this film heralds a welcome alternative for the chronically bereaved.
response.tagline: A severely grief-stricken widow volunteers to take part in an unconventional study where scientists induce "sensory reconnections" between survivor and deceased - the first publicly funded research of its kind.
response.title: Life with Ghosts
